com.i2group.apollo.documentstore

Class FileUploadServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.i2group.apollo.documentstore.DocumentStoreServletBase
          • com.i2group.apollo.documentstore.FileUploadServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public class FileUploadServlet
extends com.i2group.apollo.documentstore.DocumentStoreServletBase
    Represents the servlet that enables file uploads to the Analysis Repository through HTTP POST. Depending on its size, a file may be uploaded in a single request, or through a series of requests. To facilitate this, the upload servlet supports four parameters: fileName, totalSize, documentID, and complete.

    Starting an upload

    To start an upload to the Analysis Repository, the first HTTP POST request must include the fileName and totalSize parameters: 
     POST FileUploadServlet?fileName=...&totalSize=...
    The value supplied to the totalSize parameter is the number of bytes in the file, which must be greater than 0 and less than the maxFileSizeInMb setting from the ApolloServerSettings.properties configuration file.

    When the upload servlet receives this request, it writes any binary content in the HTTP request body to the repository, and returns a unique document identifier as part of the HTTP response.

    Continuing an upload

    After submitting the first request and receiving a document identifier, the client can make further HTTP POST requests that include the documentId parameter, and whose bodies contain further binary data that will be added to the specified document: 
     POST FileUploadServlet?documentId=...
 POST FileUploadServlet?documentId=...
 POST FileUploadServlet?documentId=...
    The accumulated size of uploaded data must not exceed the original limit set in the totalSize parameter. Note that while it is possible to add the fileName and totalSize parameters to these requests, the servlet will ignore their values.

    Warning: Do not submit parallel upload requests to the same document. Uploads to a single document must take place in series. You may, however, submit parallel upload requests to multiple documents.

    Completing an upload

    To indicate that an upload is complete, the client can add the complete parameter to any request to the upload servlet, including the first (and, in that case, only) one: 
     POST FileUploadServlet?documentId=...&complete
    Or: 
     POST FileUploadServlet?fileName=...&totalSize=...&complete
    A call containing the complete parameter will not return until the servlet has finished processing the uploaded file. If, when any associated data has been uploaded, the size of the document after the last request is not equal to the totalSize parameter, an error is reported.

    In general

    The file upload servlet interprets parameter values using the encoding specified with the request. If an encoding is not specified, then UTF-8 is used to interpret the parameter values.

    In its header, each request must supply a Content-Length, which must be less than or equal to the maximum file size defined by maxFileSizeInMb. If the content length is too large, then a response with status code 200 is created. The response includes the text ERROR_FILE_SIZE_EXCEEDED, together with the maximum permitted size of a file in megabytes.

    Any invalid HTTP request will result in error code 400.

    Example

    This is an example of a HTTP request that would start a file upload: 
     POST http://localhost/apollo/services/FileUploadServlet?fileName=Shakespeare.txt&totalSize=4750838 HTTP/1.1
 Accept: */*
 Accept-Language: en-GB
 Content-Length: 131072
 Content-Type: application/octet-stream
 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
 User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 
 Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
 Connection: Keep-Alive
 Pragma: no-cache
 
 All's Well That Ends Well Shakespeare homepage | All's Well That Ends Well | Entire play ACT I
 SCENE I. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
    Since:
    1.0
